definition: (affectionate form of address for a male who is not very much younger than oneself) my boy/old pal

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
younger brother/junior male/I (modest word in letter)

sentences.english: Come on, O-Dog, don't make me chase you to this thing.
sentences.chinese: 好了，欧老弟，别让我逼着你做这件事。

sentences.english: Joyce, you stand by the west, my man.
sentences.chinese: 乔埃斯，你站在西面，老弟。

sentences.english: I know what you think it means, sonny.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你们是怎么想的，小老弟。

sentences.english: I can spare you a loan, bud , if you're short on cash.
sentences.chinese: 老弟，要是你缺钱的话，我可以借给你。

sentences.english: Hey bro, you got my message?
sentences.chinese: 嘿，老弟，你收到我的简了吗？

sentences.english: Thanks brother's concernment . I'm fine and begin to clear up the things on hand today.
sentences.chinese: 谢老弟挂念，没事了，今天又开始整理手上的东西了。

sentences.english: And that my dear boy is the whole point of the exercise.
sentences.chinese: 而这，亲爱的老弟，正是那样做的目的。

sentences.english: Nay, laddie, thar be one more order I need ta give here.
sentences.chinese: 才不，老弟，俺这儿还有条命令要下。
我说老弟阿，你可不知道。

sentences.english: So you go on and stamp your forms, sonny, and stop wasting my time.
sentences.chinese: 你继续盖上你的印章吧老弟，别再浪费我的时间了。

sentences.english: Now you’ve got a little brother maybe it’s really you?
sentences.chinese: 如今你有了小老弟，这是真的吗？

definition: elder brother (often used self-referentially)/(form of address between male friends) old chap/buddy
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
young disciple (of the same master)/younger or junior male schoolmate
You're really quite something!/You're just amazing!
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
to set off/to take to the road
uncle (affectionate name for a friend older than one's father)/old friend
